title: Olympiacos vs Real Madrid : Full Match Breakdown and Key Highlights
body_text:
The Olympiacos–Real Madrid clash quickly became one of the week’s most talked-about fixtures – and interest in Cameroon was especially high. Local fans have been following the Champions League closely through the Linebet app, which offers fast, safe and free access to match stats, in-depth analytics and coverage across dozens of sports. Naturally, this game drew massive attention: a dramatic storyline, surprise goals, Mbappé’s historic four-goal performance, and a nerve-shredding finale that kept fans on edge until the very last minute.
Both sides entered the game with different targets but with the same determination to deliver a statement win.
Match Date, Venue and Team Motivation
The match was held on November 26, 2025, at the iconic Georgios Karaiskakis Stadium in Piraeus. Olympiacos stepped onto the pitch hoping to finally gain momentum and lift themselves from the bottom of the standings, where they were stuck with just two points. Real Madrid, meanwhile, continued their confident march through the group stage, aiming to strengthen their place among the top contenders.
For Olympiacos, this was a chance to show their home crowd that they could still deliver a big performance. For Madrid, it was an opportunity to prove that experience and European pedigree win even in the most intimidating away atmosphere.
Match Flow, Key Moments, Standout Players and Result
The game opened with instant drama. In the 8th minute, Chiquinho sent the stadium into a frenzy – 1–0, and Olympiacos briefly tasted the possibility of a major upset. But the joy didn’t last long.
Between the 22nd and 29th minutes, Mbappé produced a moment of pure brilliance that dominated football discussions in Cameroon: three goals in seven minutes. A lightning-fast hat-trick that flipped the match on its head. Real Madrid took control immediately, created chance after chance and punished every defensive mistake with the precision of a top European side.
Yet Olympiacos refused to fold. In the 52nd minute, Taremi pulled one back for 2–3, restoring hope. But Mbappé, in unstoppable form, struck again in the 60th minute – his fourth of the night – to make it 2–4 and effectively seal the match.
El-Kaabi’s goal in the 81st minute made it 3–4 and set up a tense ending, but Real Madrid kept their composure and held on.
The stats told the story clearly:
- Madrid created more shots and higher-quality chances.
- They controlled possession throughout.
- Every Mbappé run threatened to split the defense.
- Real’s xG numbers far exceeded those of the hosts.
The result widened the gap between the teams in the standings: Olympiacos stayed 33rd in the combined table with two points, while Real Madrid climbed to fifth on 12.
Analysts also highlighted the mental resilience on both sides. Olympiacos repeatedly raised their intensity after conceding, but structurally they struggled to deal with Madrid’s attacking patterns. Real played like an experienced boxer – absorbing isolated blows, then responding calmly and decisively with moves that cut right through the Greek defense.

Olympiacos travel to face Kairat on December 9.
